cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ESE of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across Cuba, then turning north-northwest/north and tracking just offshore the Florida west coast toward the Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: West coast of Florida near or just north of Tampa Bay (Big Bend/Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West coast of Florida from Englewood northward to the Aucilla River (includes Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.warning_coast: West coast of Florida from Flamingo to Englewood; Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida west coast from the Keys through the Big Bend, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely with gusts possibly reaching 60-70 mph as the center passes nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in Tampa Bay and adjacent coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with localized amounts up to 6 inches could cause flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Tuesday into Wednesday; elevated seas and dangerous surf for vessel operations.
